article: 12 Ways to Break a Narcissist's Heart
intro: Narcissistic personality disorder, or NPD, is characterized by a lack of empathy, an overinflated ego, and a sense of entitlement.

steps.title: Go after , without worrying about their opinion.
steps.subtitle: When you’re with a narcissist, they might try to undermine you and make you think you can’t trust yourself. They want you to feel like you’re less important than they are, but you’re just as competent and capable. Make the choices that feel right to you, and avoid giving them any control over you or your life. The best thing you can do is .
sub-points: You might go after the job you want, even though they said you wouldn’t be good at it. Similarly, you may decide to start a new hobby even though your ex said it would be a waste of time.

points.name: Flaunt how well things are going in your life.

steps.title: Seeing you happy will make your ex regret losing you.
steps.subtitle: Some narcissists don’t have the emotional capacity for true happiness. They can only play games and try to put others down. Show them you’re living  without them, and they’ll experience their own version of heartbreak. You could:
sub-points: Post photos on social media of you having fun with friends or family.
Brag to your mutual friends about your accomplishments or progress on goals.
Go on a few casual or group dates to dip your toes in the dating scene.

steps.title: Boundaries help you move on.
steps.subtitle: by figuring out what you need from this person. Then, tell them your expectations for them. Be honest about what you’re willing to accept from them, and what you won’t allow. You might say things like:
sub-points: “Please stop contacting me.”
“Don’t share my photos with other people.”
“I won’t talk to you when you’re yelling.”
“I’m ending the conversation if you call me names.”
“I’m only going to talk to you about the kids.”

steps.title: Narcissists may play games to manipulate you, but you don't have to buy in.
steps.subtitle: They might have a whole slew of games they use to control you, such as , , and revenge. Avoid playing their games, and just ignore them when they try to manipulate you so they don’t have control anymore.
sub-points: Don't argue with a narcissist because they might just keep escalating things until they get their way. Someone with NPD is incapable of seeing things from your point of view. Just ignore them.

Revenge is actually one of the narcissist’s games. When they feel slighted, they may spread rumors about you, destroy your stuff, or get violent. In some cases, they'll pursue revenge over a long period of time.

steps.title: Focusing on your needs shows them what they’re losing.
steps.subtitle: Many narcissists are users. They expect you to be there for them, but they have no intention of reciprocating. Start  to them, and focus on what you want instead. They’ll get super frustrated and realize how great a partner you were for them.
sub-points: Stop returning their phone calls and texts.
Don’t react to anything they say or do.
Refuse to give them compliments.
Stop doing favors for them.

points.name: Stay calm when they try to upset you.

steps.title: Narcissists need a reaction from you to be fulfilled, so don't give them one.
steps.subtitle: They want you to get mad, distressed, or apologetic. Any type of reaction will make them feel like they’re winning, whether it’s lashing out, crying, or apologizing. Even though it’s hard, do your best to  and not react. Try:
sub-points: Taking several deep breaths.
Counting to 10.
Repeating the word “relax” to yourself.
Imagining a calm scene.
Stretching.

points.name: Cut off all contact with them if you can.

steps.title: Communicating with your ex gives them power, so take it away.
steps.subtitle: They may try to use lines of communication to weasel their way back into your life. On the other hand,  makes them feel your loss. Block them on your phone and social media, and try to avoid places they’ll be.
sub-points: You might have to keep talking to them if you have kids together or if you work with them. Try to keep your conversations limited to talking about your children or your job.

points.name: Be leery of future love bombing.

steps.title: Avoid their attempts to suck you back in to keep control over your life.
steps.subtitle: Some narcissists use a tactic called love bombing to draw you in, They may treat you like they did in the beginning of your relationship—charming and sweet. They’re hoping to draw you back to them, which is called “hoovering.” However, this change is temporary, and they’ll often be back to their narcissistic behavior again once you lower your defenses. Brush off their efforts and you’ll come out on top.
sub-points: They’ll likely shower you with compliments and tell you how much they miss you. They’re only going to keep this up until you come back, and then they’ll be back to their games.

points.name: Love yourself instead of loving them.

steps.title: Use your energy to feed your own ego to prove that you're important.
steps.subtitle: Instead of showering them with love, focus your efforts on meeting your own needs. Additionally, go after your hopes and dreams. Seeing you shine will drive a narcissist crazy and show them once and for all that they have no power over you.
sub-points: that are important to you.
so you look and feel your best.

points.name: Build a support system for yourself.

steps.title: Rely on people who care about you as you recover.
steps.subtitle: You deserve love and support, and there are people out there who truly value you. You might even  who don’t know your ex. That way, you’ll have people who are totally on your side.
sub-points: It’s possible that a narcissist will try to turn some people against you. This experience can be super painful, but it has nothing to do with you. Eventually, most people will recognize that your ex is the true problem. In the meantime, spend time with people who see your truth.

points.name: Don’t take on blame or guilt.

steps.title: Narcissists may try to blame you for everything, but you’re not responsible.
steps.subtitle: If your ex insulted, gaslit, or lied to you, their behavior is not your fault. When you start to feel critical of yourself, remind yourself that you aren’t responsible. Additionally, talk to someone you trust who can offer you encouragement.
sub-points: Tell yourself things like, “I did everything I could to make our relationship wonderful,” “I can’t control anyone else’s actions,” and “I gave 100% to my relationship.”
Vent about your experiences to someone you can trust. Unfortunately, talking to a narcissist may only make them work harder to make you feel bad.

steps.title: Narcissists may try to steal your power by criticizing you, so focus on self-empowerment.
steps.subtitle: Their insults can damage , and they may have even made you doubt yourself. The truth is that you’re very worthy of love, and you have lots of wonderful and unique qualities that make you special. Take some time to remind yourself what makes you amazing.
sub-points: Consider working with a therapist to help you rebuild your self-esteem after this toxic relationship. They can help you .
